decks.notes: This deck revolves around utilizing small evasive creatures and spells to deal consistent damage to the opponent while also disrupting their game plan with counterspells and removal. Yuriko, the Tiger's Shadow, serves as the commander and key source of card advantage by allowing the player to draw cards whenever she deals combat damage. The deck includes a variety of low-cost creatures with abilities that make them difficult to block, such as Flying or Unblockable, enabling the player to trigger Yuriko's ability consistently. In addition, the deck includes a range of cheap counterspells and removal spells to control the board and protect its own creatures. The overall strategy is to maintain pressure on the opponent while disrupting their strategy and gaining card advantage through Yuriko's ability.

The deck focuses on utilizing aggressive creatures and burn spells to quickly reduce the opponent's life total. With Tajic, Legion's Edge as the commander, the deck includes various aggressive one-drop creatures like Goblin Guide and Figure of Destiny, along with efficient burn spells such as Lightning Bolt and Incinerate. The deck also includes resilient threats like Gideon Blackblade and Elspeth, Knight-Errant to provide staying power in longer games. The mana base is configured to support the deck's aggressive game plan, with a mix of lands that provide both red and white mana sources. Overall, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with quick and efficient threats while keeping up pressure through burn spells and combat tricks.

This deck revolves around using Urza, Lord High Artificer to control the battlefield and disrupt the opponent's strategy. It includes a variety of counterspells, card draw, artifact tutors, and mana ramp to ensure Urza's abilities can be maximized. The deck also includes a selection of powerful artifacts such as Winter Orb, Ugin, the Spirit Dragon, and Wurmcoil Engine to create a strong board presence and win conditions. By efficiently managing resources and leveraging Urza's abilities, the deck aims to outvalue and outmaneuver opponents in a 1 vs 1 format. It focuses on disrupting opponents while building up a battlefield advantage to secure the win.

The main focus of this deck is to control the game through a combination of countermagic, removal, and disruptive spells while also utilizing powerful card advantage engines. The deck includes a diverse range of spells that can disrupt the opponent's strategy, such as counterspells like Force of Will and Dovin's Veto, removal spells like Dreadbore and Terminate, and disruptive spells like Thought Erasure and Sin Collector. The deck also includes powerful card draw engines like Niv-Mizzet Reborn and Dream Halls to help maintain card advantage and stay ahead in the game. By carefully managing resources and disrupting the opponent's strategy, this control deck aims to outvalue and outmaneuver its opponent to secure victory.

The deck focuses on controlling the game through a combination of counterspells, removal spells, and card advantage. Aminatou, the Fateshifter serves as a versatile commander, able to blink key creatures or permanents for value. The deck includes a mix of powerful planeswalkers like Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Teferi, Hero of Dominaria, along with game-ending threats like Emrakul, the Promised End. With access to a wide range of versatile spells like Cryptic Command, Wrath of God, and Demonic Tutor, the deck is able to adapt to various situations and outmaneuver opponents. The goal is to control the board, disrupt opponents' strategies, and ultimately win through card advantage and powerful threats.

The key concept of this deck is to control the game by using a variety of removal spells, hand disruption, and board wipes to disrupt the opponent's game plan. Queen Marchesa serves as the commander, providing card advantage and protection. The deck includes a mix of spot removal like Lightning Bolt and Path to Exile, along with sweepers like Wrath of God and Damnation. It also includes hand disruption spells like Thoughtseize and Hymn to Tourach to disrupt the opponent's hand. The deck has a versatile mana base with fetch lands and dual lands to ensure consistent mana production. Overall, the goal is to outvalue the opponent by controlling the board and grinding out a win.

The deck revolves around the commander Karlov of the Ghost Council, utilizing lifegain synergies to control the board and pressure opponents with aggressive creatures. It combines cards that provide lifegain such as Soul Warden, Serra Ascendant, and various lands with lifegain abilities, along with removal spells like Anguished Unmaking and Collective Brutality to deal with threats. The deck also includes disruptive elements like thoughtseize and Duress to disrupt opponents' strategies. With a focus on lifegain, removal, and disruption, the deck aims to gain an advantage through resource management and efficient plays, ultimately overwhelming opponents with Karlov's abilities and aggressive creatures.
